text:
- Hi.
- Hey

Hey, how did 
it go with Elizabeth?
Huh? Oh-oh, it was fine.

Uh, it was just
a-a misunderstanding.

She didn't want me
to go with her.

She just wanted
to let me know that

she's going to Florida
for spring vacation.

Wait a minute, is she going
for spring vacation

or is she going
for spring break?
Whoo-ho-he.
What's-what's the difference?

Well, a spring vacation
you're doing

nice things
with your grandparents.

Spring break
you're doing frat guys.
Hey, you know what, not all

spring breaks
are-are like that.
What did you do on yours?
I went to Egypt with my dad.
I can see it now.
Look, dad, it's the Sphinx.
Boo-whoo-whoa-hu.

I think Elizabeth is a little
more serious than spring break.
Whoa-he-whoo.

Alright. I mean, come on,
she's taken my class.
And slept with the professor.

- I'm gonna call her.
- Yeah.

- Hey!
- 'Hey.'

- 'Hey.'
- You guys.

Um, I want you
to meet Sebastian.

- Hi.
- We just, uh..

We just met at the newsstand,
we both grabbed
for the last "Field & Stream."
What? I read that.

Can I get you
a cup of coffee?

- Oh, yes, thank you.
- Okay.

- Rachel, what the hell is this?
- What?
You ask us to find you a guy
and then, you come traipsing
in here with a guy of your own?
You found me a guy?

Yes, we found you
a really cute

and funny guy
from Chandler's work.
Yeah, and I-I found you one too
who is not a weirdo.

Well, you know what,
though, you guys?
I really appreciate that

but I-I'm just gonna take
Sebastian to the charity.

Are you sure? Because
our guy smells incredible.

Uh, would you stop it
with that already?

- Here you go.
- Oh, thank you.

- Sure.
- Ahem.
So, Sebastian
do you do any volunteer work?
Uh, no, not really. Why?

No reason. It's just
I know a single guy

who does care
about other people.
Are you funny?

- Excuse me?
- What are you guys doing?
Are you funny? Tell us a joke!

Look, I just wanted to
have coffee with Rachel.

- Yeah.
- Well, so do a lot of people.

Actually, uh,
I got to get going.

- Oh..
- Give me a call sometime.

Oh, but you know, you didn't
give me your phone number.
Okay, see you later.
Turns out he is kinda funny.
[instrumental music]
I cannot believe you guys.
He was really nice
and he just left because of you.
Yeah, but Sebastian?
What is that, a cat's name?

Yeah, you know what
I noticed, Rachel?
He scares easy, you know?

Is that the kind of guy
you wanna take to a ball?

Hey, Sebastian, would you
like to dance?
Uh, okay, I gotta go. Uh-uh..

Alright, guys, stop it.
Rachel, uh, we're very sorry.

That is, uh, very insensitive
thing for us to do

and, you know what,
let us make it up to you.

We have two really
great guys for you.

(Phoebe)
'Yeah, what have
you got to lose?'

You know, you might even end up
with someone really special
if you pick my guy.

- Alright.
- Okay.

- So you will meet our guys?
- Yes, I'll meet 'em.

Okay, now, it doesn't matter
which one you choose.

You know,
it's completely up to you.
Our guy is perfect.

Or you could go out with
the guy that Phoebe deemed

not good enough
to go out with herself.
Phoebe, there you are.

Okay, you broke my fridge.
You owe me 400 bucks.

- Okay, sure.
- Really?

Ooh, technically,
you owe me $600

for sending out happy thoughts
on your last ten auditions.
Call it even?
Okay.

Well, there you are.
So what did Elizabeth say?
Well, it turns out she is going
to Daytona for spring break.
Whoo-hoo.

That means, that means
Wet T-Shirt Contest

guys doing shots
off of a girls' bodies

wakin' up next to people
you don't even know.

Man, she is gonna have
a great time.

Uh, is she staying
at the Hotel Corona?

- You know the hotels?
- Sure. I was there.
Spring break '81. Whoo-hee!

- In 1981, you were 13.
- So what?

I drove down, sold T-shirts.
Had a blast.

And you know who
knows how to party?
Drunk college chicks.

[sighs]
Okay, she can't go.

Ross, you can't tell her not
to go. You just started dating.
Then, what am I supposed to do?

Nothing. You just have
to be cool with it.

Well, what if
she goes down there

and-and sleeps with
a bunch of guys?

Well, maybe you don't
marry this one.
[instrumental music]
